page.title: 02AN INDUSTRIAL LANDSCAPE
page.content: Heworth Grange School-Surroundings 1766-heworth araa was all farmland 1826-Quarries and coalmines an established part of area. Early signs of industry all sides of the River Tyne. 1860's-All of ,riversides industrialised with terraced housing away from river for workers. River Tyne and its banks continued to be the focus of industries in the area untill the 1950's Housing continued to spread away from riverside. After 2nd world War large council housing estates were built to house people from old housing areas and new arrivals. Most of the housing was semi-detached with gardens.
